snippet: Two professors propose a federal agency, in some ways like the F.D.A., that would test the social utility of financial products before they were allowed on the market.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column on proposal by professors Eric A Posner and E Glen Weyl for a federal agency that would test the social utility of financial products before they were allowed on the market; points out that while their proposal is unlikely to move forward anytime soon, their ideas could generate discussion about measuring the social costs of financial products, which in itself would be a step forward.
lead_paragraph: Two professors propose a federal agency, in some ways like the F.D.A., that would test the social utility of financial products before they were allowed on the market.
